topic: Writing High‑Quality Multiple‑Choice Questions (MCQs): From Pitfalls to Powerful Assessments
target_audience: teachers, instructional designers, assessment authors in K–12 and higher education

refs.content: Comprehensive item-writing guidelines for MCQs: focus stems, plausible distractors, avoid negatives and 'all/none of the above'.
Flawed items can inflate scores and undermine validity; common flaws catalogued with examples and corrections.
Three-option items often perform as well as four/five options due to low‑performing distractors; recommends fewer, better distractors.

special_instructions: Provide a 20‑point checklist with positive/negative examples. Include a mini bank of rewritten items demonstrating improved stems and distractors.
